english_translation: Narrated by Abu Barzah al-Aslami: Juleibib was a man from the Ansar, and he would enter upon women and converse with them. Abu Barzah said: I said to my wife: Beware, let not Juleibib enter upon you! The Companions of the Prophet ﷺ, when one of them had an unmarried woman, would not marry her until the Messenger ﷺ indicated whether he had need of her or not. One day the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to a man from the Ansar: 'Give me your daughter in marriage.' He said: 'Yes, and yes again!' He said: 'I do not desire her for myself.' He said: 'For whom?' He said: 'For Juleibib.' He said: 'O Messenger of Allah, until I consult her mother.' He came to her and said: 'The Messenger of Allah seeks your daughter in marriage.' She said: 'Yes, and yes again, give her to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ.' He said: 'He does not desire her for himself.' She said: 'For whom?' He said: 'He desires her for Juleibib.' She said: 'Fie on Juleibib! No, by Allah, I will not marry Juleibib!' When her father stood up to come to the Messenger ﷺ, the young woman said from behind her curtain: 'Who has proposed marriage to you both?' They said: 'The Messenger of Allah ﷺ.' She said: 'Do you refuse the command of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ? Send me to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, for he will not waste me.' So her father went to the Prophet ﷺ and said: 'Do as you please with her.' So he married her to Juleibib. Hammad said: Ishaq ibn Abi Talha said: Do you know what the Prophet ﷺ supplicated for her? He said: 'What did he supplicate?' He said: 'O Allah, pour goodness upon them abundantly and do not make their livelihood a struggle.' Thabit said: So he married her to him. While the Messenger of Allah ﷺ was in a military expedition and Allah granted him spoils, he ﷺ said: 'Do you miss anyone?' They said: 'We miss so-and-so and so-and-so.' Then he said: 'Do you miss anyone?' They said: 'We miss so-and-so and so-and-so.' Then he said: 'Do you miss anyone?' They said: 'We miss so-and-so and so-and-so.' He said: 'But I miss Juleibib!' He was searched for among the slain, and they found him beside seven whom he had killed, then they killed him. The Prophet ﷺ stood and said: 'He killed seven, then they killed him. This one is from me and I am from him.' Then the Messenger of Allah ﷺ carried him on his forearms. He had no bier except the forearms of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ until he dug for him, then placed him in his grave and did not mention washing. Thabit said: There was no widow among the Ansar more productive in charity than her.
